Description: Body sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style pottery stemmed dish; faded white slip; interior: from outside, possibly lotus flower and bud frieze with added red; between bands with added red bands lined in white, frieze of battlement and squares; to centre, lotus bud and tongue motif (parts of two black petals and one petal in added red and tip of black bud remaining); exterior: one band preserved towards rim, three nearer centre.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.869)
